tbs.server

Interface TBSServer


  • public interface TBSServer
    Provides the interface to a server for a theatre booking system (TBS). The server manages acts held in theatres. An act is put on by an artist (e.g. "Greta Van Fleet"), and has a duration. An act has a series of performances (e.g., "Friday night at 6pm", "Saturday matinee at 2pm", and "Saturday night at 8pm") Performances take place in a theatre. Tickets are issued for seats. Seats in theatres are arranged as a square block, with as many seats in a row as there are rows. A seat is identified by the row number it is in and its position in the row. About half the seats are considered "premium" seating. These are the lowest numbered rows.

    • Method Detail

      • addAct

        java.lang.String addAct(java.lang.String title,
                        java.lang.String artistID,
                        int minutesDuration)
        Request that an act by the specified artist with the specified title and of the specified duration be added to the server.

        If there is a problem with the title (is empty), artist ID (is not unique or is empty), or duration (is less than or equal to zero), then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        title - The title of the act
        artistID - The ID to be used to identify the artist
        minutesDuration - The time that the act will take in minutes
        Returns:
        The ID for the new act if the addition is successful, otherwise a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR title is empty"). The ID must be unique to all acts but is otherwise implementation dependent.

        Marks: 1

      • addArtist

        java.lang.String addArtist(java.lang.String name)
        Request that an artist with the specified name be added to the server.

        If there is a problem with the name (is empty, or there is already an artist with the same name) then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the artist.
        Returns:
        The ID for the new artist if the addition is successful, otherwise a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR artist already exists"). The ID must be unique to all artists but is otherwise implementation dependent.

        Marks: 1

      • dump

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> dump()
        Request a list of strings containing information the TBS Server has that is relevant. Implement this how you like to support any debugging you need to do.
        Returns:
        A list of strings that in some way describe information that the TBS Server has.

        Marks: 0 This will not be marked. It is for your convenience for debugging.

      • getActIDsForArtist

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getActIDsForArtist(java.lang.String artistID)
        Request a list of the IDs for all acts by the artist with the specified ID.

        If there is a problem with the artist ID (is empty, or there is no artist with that ID) then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        artistID - The ID to be used to identify the artist
        Returns:
        A list of act IDs in alphabetical order. If the request fails, there should be exactly one entry in the list, and that will be a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR no act with specified ID").

        Marks: 1

      • getArtistIDs

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArtistIDs()
        Request a list of the IDs for all artists.
        Returns:
        A list of artist IDs in alphabetical order.

        Marks: 1

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getArtistNames()
        Request a list of the names for all artists.
        Returns:
        A list of artist names in alphabetical order

        Marks: 1

      • getPeformanceIDsForAct

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getPeformanceIDsForAct(java.lang.String actID)
        Request a list of the IDs for all performances for the act with the specified ID.

        If there is a problem with the act ID (is empty, or there is no act with that ID) then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        actID - The ID to be used to identify the act.
        Returns:
        A list of performance IDs in alphabetical order If the request fails, there should be exactly one entry in the list, and that will be a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR actID is empty").

        Marks: 1

      • getTheatreIDs

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTheatreIDs()
        Request a list of the IDs for all theatres.
        Returns:
        A list of theatre IDs in alphabetical order.

        Marks: 1

      • getTicketIDsForPerformance

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getTicketIDsForPerformance(java.lang.String performanceID)
        Request a list of the IDs for all tickets issued for the performance with the specified ID.

        If there is a problem with the performance ID (is empty, or there is no performance with that ID) then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        performanceID - The ID to be used to identify the performance.
        Returns:
        A list of ticket IDs in alphabetical order If the request fails, there should be exactly one entry in the list, and that will be a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR no performance with specified ID").

        Marks: 1

      • initialise

        java.lang.String initialise(java.lang.String path)
        Request the server to add the theatre details found in the file indicated by the path. The details include the theatre ID (unique across all theatres), the seating dimension, and the floor area (square metres). All theatres have as many seats in a row as they do rows, and the number of rows is indicated by the seating dimension.

        The file format is, each line consists of "THEATRE" "\t" <theatre ID> "\t" <seating dimension> "\t" <floor area>

        If there is no file associated with the path, or the file format is incorrect, then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        path - The path indicating the file to use for the initialisation.
        Returns:
        An empty string if the initialisation is successful, otherwise a message explaining what went wrong beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR incorrect format").

        Marks: 0 There are no marks specific to this method. If you do not implement this method, you will be limited as to what else you can implement as this method is the only way to add theatres to the server.

      • issueTicket

        java.lang.String issueTicket(java.lang.String performanceID,
                             int rowNumber,
                             int seatNumber)
        Request the server to issue a ticket for the performance with the specified ID and for the seat at the specified location.

        If there is a problem with the performance ID (no performance with that ID exists), or the seat (the seat doesn't exist, or a ticket for it has already been issued), then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        performanceID - The ID for the performance the ticket should be issued for.
        rowNumber - The row the seat is in
        seatNumber - The number of the seat in the row.
        Returns:
        The ID for the new ticket if the issue is successful, otherwise a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR seat has already been taken"). The ID must be unique to all tickets but is otherwise implementation dependent.

        Marks: 2

      • salesReport

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> salesReport(java.lang.String actID)
        Request the server to supply a list reporting the sales for the act with the specified ID.

        The request fails if there is no act with the specified ID.

        Parameters:
        actID - The ID of the act that the sales report should be generated for.
        Returns:
        A list of strings, with each string representing the sales report for a performance schedule for the act. The format of the string is:
        <performanceID> "\t" <start time> "\t" <number of tickets sold> "\t' <totals sales receipts for performance>
        The sales receipts is the sum of the prices for the tickets that have been sold.

        If the request fails, then the only entry in the list will be a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR

        Marks: 2

      • schedulePerformance

        java.lang.String schedulePerformance(java.lang.String actID,
                                     java.lang.String theatreID,
                                     java.lang.String startTimeStr,
                                     java.lang.String premiumPriceStr,
                                     java.lang.String cheapSeatsStr)
        Request the server to schedule a performance for the act with the specified ID in the theatre with the specified ID, starting at the specified time and with the specified seat prices. Different performances can have different seat prices (e.g. Monday-Thursday are cheaper than Friday and Saturday). The premium price applies to the seats in the rows closest to the stage, which in this case are rows 1 to floor(Number of Rows/2). The remaining seats have the cheap seat price. For example, if the seating dimension is 5, then rows 1-2 will be premium, and 3-5 cheap.

        If there is a problem with the act ID (is not unique), theatre ID (no such theatre exists), or other parameters (wrong format), then the request fails.

        Parameters:
        actID - The ID that identifies the act. It must be unique with respect to acts already managed by the server.
        theatreID - The ID of the theatre. There must be a theatre with this ID.
        startTimeStr - The start time for this performance. It must be in the ISO8601 format yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm (zero-padded)
        premiumPriceStr - The price for the premium seats. It must be in the format $d where <d> is the number of dollars.
        cheapSeatsStr - The price for the cheap seats. It must be in the format $d where <d> is the number of dollars.
        Returns:
        The ID for the new performance if the addition is successful, otherwise a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR (e.g. "ERROR theatre with theatre ID does not exist"). The ID must be unique to all performances but is otherwise implementation dependent.

        Marks: 2

      • seatsAvailable

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> seatsAvailable(java.lang.String performanceID)
        Request the server to supply a list of the seats that are still available for the performance with the specified ID.

        The request fails if there is no performance with the specified ID.

        Parameters:
        performanceID - The ID for the performance to determine the available seats for.
        Returns:
        A list of strings, with each string representing a seat that is available. The format of the string is <row number> "\t" <seat position> (that is the two numbers separated by a tab character).

        If the request fails, then the only entry in the list will be a message explaining what went wrong, beginning with ERROR.

        Marks: 2
